{"step_by_step_thinking": "Essential amino acids are those that the body cannot synthesize on its own and must be obtained from the diet. The essential amino acids include Phenylalanine, Tryptophan, Lysine, Methionine, Valine, and Histidine. Asparagine, Glutamine, and Glycine are non-essential amino acids, meaning the body can synthesize them. Therefore, the option that includes only essential amino acids is the correct one.", "answer_choice": "A"}
